privacyLaws.description: Introduced on January 25, 2023, this bill grants rights to Washington consumers and outlines penalties for data controllers who breach those rights. It was referred to the Civil Rights & Judiciary Committee.

Introduced on January 31, 2023, this bill describes the Peopleâ€™s Privacy Act, granting rights to Washington residents regarding how their personal data gets collected, processed, and used. It was referred to the Environment, Energy, & Technology Committee.
Entered into effect in 2020 and requires entities to notify affected individuals about a breach if it impacts more than 500 individuals.
The Privacy Act recognizes the right of privacy for a resident in WA
The bill made it through the third hearing then it became inactive in Feburary 2022. The bill concerned the management, oversight, and use of data.
